datafield.subfield: [Matn al-Ḥaqāʼiq maʻa Qiṣṣat al-shākī wa-lawʻāt al-bākī,
متن السنوسي متن الحقائق ولوعة الشاكي
Title of second work from inscription on verso of front flyleaf:
Title of opening work from inscription on verso of front flyleaf:
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 959

Origin: As appears in colophon on p.19, transcription of opening work completed 3 [?] Shaʻbān 1226 [ca. 23 August 1811]. As appears in colophon on p.130, transcription of second work completed 8 Shawwāl 1183 [ca. 4 February 1770].
Former shelfmark: Mich. Isl. Ms. temp. no. 108

Binding: Boards covered in textured black cloth with black leather over spine (quarter binding) ; Western style binding ; pastedowns and flyleaves in wove paper printed with a floral vegetal pattern in pink and green ; spine gold-stamped with title and decorative accents over raised bands "متن السنوسي متن الحقائق ولوعة الشاكي" ; sewn in white thread over three recessed cords ; overall in fairly good condition with minor abrasion.

Support: European laid paper of three different types, each section in a distinct type ; opening section (carrying first work) in a type with 7 laid lines per cm. (horizontal), chain lines spaced 26-29 mm. apart (vertical), and three crescents watermark (perpendicular to chains, see pp.6, 8, 14, etc.), quite sturdy, dark cream in color, well-burnished, minor ink burn ; second section (carrying second work) mainly in a type with 6-7 laid lines per cm. (horizontal), chain lines spaced 25 mm. apart (vertical), and watermarks of three crescents (perpendicular to chains, see pp.26, 82, 86, 90, etc.) and possibly crown-star-crescent (see p.108, etc.), sturdy, medium cream in color, well-burnished ; replacement section (pp.41-60) in still another type with three crescents watermark (see pp.48, 50, 52).
Decoration: Keywords rubricated ; some overlining in red.

Script: Naskh ; two clear though somewhat awkward Egyptian hands, the opening hand in a bold line, the latter in a medium line ; opening hand supplying the first work (though p.19) large and serifless with slight effect of tilt to the left, elongation of many descenders, many closed counters, pointing in distinct dots except for three dots (represented by a curved stroke resembling an inverted comma), alif maqṣūrah usually pointed as yāʼ ; hand supplying second work (from p.21) small and seriffed with right sloping head-serifs on most ascenders, curvilinear descenders, pointing in distinct dots, alif maqṣūrah usually pointed as yāʼ ; replacement section (pp.41-60) in still a different hand, awkward, large, elongated and somewhat flattened in the horizontal.
Layout: Written in 15 and 17 lines per page ; frame-ruled (impression of ruling board visible (see pp.19-20, 132-134 in particular).

Collation: i, 6 V(60), III+2 (68), i ; almost exclusively quinions ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (mistakenly skips two pages between pp.121-122).

Colophon: [Matn al-Ḥaqāʼiq] "Scribal," triangular, reads "تم هذا الكتاب بحمد الله وعونه وحسن توفيقه في يوم الثلاث المبارك من شهر شعبان من شهور سنة ١٢٢٦ والله اعلم" ; [Qiṣṣat al-shākī wa-lawʻat al-bākī] "Scribal," triangular, reads "تمت هذه النسخة المباركة بحمد الله تعالى وعونه وحسن توفيقه والله اعلم ثمانية من شوال سنة ١١٨٣ من الهجرة النبوية "

Explicit: [Matn al-Ḥaqāʼiq] "في محل العبد مخالفا لامر الرب والخلالان مثله اللهم انا نسألك العصمة من هؤلاء وبالله التوفيق ولا حول ولا قوة الا بالله العلي العظيم وصلى الله على سيدنا محمد وعلى اله وصحبه وسلم تسليما كثيرا الى يوم الدين" ; [Qiṣṣat al-shākī wa-lawʻat al-bākī] "وهذا من لطف الله الكثير يسير لانه بالحال عليم خبير وبالاجابة جدير وهو على جمعهم اذا يشاء قدير ... وحسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل نعم المولى ونعم النصير"

Incipit: [Matn al-Ḥaqāʼiq] "هذه حقائق عقيدة الشيخ الفاضل ... سيدي محمد بن يوسف السنوسي ... حقيقة الحمد هو الثناء بالكلام على المحمود بجميل صفاته ..." ; [Qiṣṣat al-shākī wa-lawʻat al-bākī] "الحمد لله رب العالمين وصلى الله على سيدنا محمد وعلى اله وصحبه وسلم تسليما كثيرا ... اما بعد حمدا لله الذي قضى بالمحنة والولوع وحكم باحراق كبد كل عاشق وولوع ... وبعد فاني اعرف اخواني واصحابي وخلاتي واترابي سلمهم الله من فتكات العشق ..."
Title supplied by cataloguer from inscriptions on 'title pages' for opening work (p.1) and for second work (p.21).
3. p.21-p.130 : Kitāb Qiṣṣat al-shākī wa-lawʻat al-bākī [ayy Lawʻat al-shākī wa damʻat al-bākī] / lil-Shaykh al-Imām Ibn Ḥajalah [ayy li-Ṣalāḥ al-Dīn Khalīl ibn Aybak al-Ṣafadī].
1. p.1-p.19 : Hādhā Matn al-Ḥaqāʼiq / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.

Composite manuscript opening with Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī's (d.1490) elucidation of the terms utilized in his treatise on the essentials of faith, Umm al-barāhīn, followed by Lawʻat al-shākī wa damʻat al-bāqī, al-Ṣafadī’s (d.1363) maqāmah in rhymed prose and verse on the pangs of love between young men, on the 'title page' here entitled Qiṣṣat al-shākī wa-lawʻāt al-bākī and attributed to Ibn Ḥajalah.

On upper pastedown label with ex libris of James Heyworth-Dunne (d.1974), stamped with inventory numbers, "Ex Libris | J. Heyworth-Dunne | D. Lit. (London) | No. 7789" ; ownership statement on 'title page' of opening work (p.1) in name of Aḥmad Abū Ḥamāmah al-Ikhnāwī ( احمد ابو حمامة الاخناوي ) ; UM Library inscription on p.3 "Dunning | Heyworth-Dunne | 6-13-51 | 71955" ; ownership statements on 'title page' of second work (p.21) include statement in name of Muḥammad Yūsuf al-Ṣafatī [?] al-Ḥanafī al-Shādhilī ( محمد يوسف الصفتي الحنفي الشاذلي ) dated 1 Muḥarram 1292 [ca. 7 February 1875] and statement in name of al-Sayyid Ḥasan ibn al-Sayyid al-Marḥūm ʻAlī ( السيد حسن ابن السيد المرحوم علي ) ; reading / study notice on 'title page' of second work (p.21) in name of the aforementioned al-Sayyid Ḥasan ( السيد حسن ) ; occasional glosses and marginal corrections.
